title: Emre Can admits he is 'not happy right now' at Juventus
text:
Emre Can admits he is unhappy at his lack of playing time at Juventus so far this season.

He was left out of their Champions League squad and has yet to start a single match under Maurizio Sarri.

Despite his lack of opportunities restricting him to just 78 minutes of action he was called up by German boss Joachim Low over the international break.

Emre Can admits he is unhappy at his lack of playing time at Juventus so far this season

'I'm not happy [at Juve] right now,' said the midfielder after Germany's 2-2 draw with Argentina on Wednesday night.

But he believes his return to action this week can kickstart his season.

'I'm not playing much at the moment. I played a lot last season, especially in important matches, for Juventus, and I also played well.

'I haven't had a chance this season but now I think that, when I return to the club, I'll have a shot at playing again.

'I'm definitely grateful to Joachim Low because I hadn't played much and he still called me up.

'That's why I was simply happy to have played again.'
description: Emre Can admits he is unhappy at his lack of playing time at Juventus so far this season. The German midfielder has yet to start a single match under Maurizio Sarri.
